sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"组成，成分，部分"之意。
means: component ： 指一个整体的组成部分。
constituent ： 常可与component换用，指某一整体不可少的部分或成分。
element ： 指一个整体必不可少或固有的部分，强调一个复杂整体中最基本、最简单的元件、元素或成分等。
ingredient ： 普通用词，含义笼统。既可指混在一起而本身没有变化的物质，如配料，又可指与别的物质混在一起，发生了变化的成分。

word_mean: 要素，成分：物质的主要部分或组分
〔化学〕元素，用化学方法不能使之分解的简单物质，由周围电子位形相似即化学性质相同的原子构成，核内质子数也相同，但核内中子数可能不同，故原子量和放射性也不同

sentence.Network_en: In order to make it safe, the element is electrically insulated.
sentence.Network_cn: 为安全起见，该元件作了电绝缘处理。

sentence.Network_en: There is an element of exhibitionism in the parents' performance too.
sentence.Network_cn: 那对父母的表现也显得有些爱出风头。

sentence.Network_en: With its unique heating element it makes perfect coffee.
sentence.Network_cn: 其独特的电热元件使它能够煮出非常美味的咖啡。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting fundamental constituents of the world or celestial objects): via Old French from Latin elementum 'principle, rudiment', translating Greek stoikheion 'step, component part'

entry.def: The different elements of something are the different parts it contains.

example.ex: The exchange of prisoners of war was one of the key elements of the UN's peace plan.
example.tran: 交换战俘是联合国和平计划的一个重要部分。

entry.def: A particular element of a situation, activity, or process is an important quality or feature that it has or needs.

example.ex: Fitness has now become an important element in our lives.
example.tran: 现在健康已经成为我们生活中的一个要素。

entry.tran: （社会或组织内部具有相同目标、信仰或习惯的）一群人，一组人，分子
entry.def: When you talk about elements within a society or organization, you are referring to groups of people who have similar aims, beliefs, or habits.

example.tran: 安保部队中的犯罪分子

entry.def: If something has an element of a particular quality or emotion, it has a certain amount of this quality or emotion.

example.ex: These reports clearly contain elements of propaganda.
example.tran: 这些报告明显带有一些宣传的意味。

entry.def: An element is a substance such as gold, oxygen, or carbon that consists of only one type of atom.

entry.tran: （电炉、热水器等的）电热元件，电热丝
entry.def: The element in an electric fire or water heater is the metal part which changes the electric current into heat.

example.ex: With its unique heating element it makes perfect coffee.
example.tran: 其独特的电热元件使它能够煮出非常美味的咖啡。

entry.def: You can refer to the weather, especially wind and rain, as the elements .

example.ex: The area where most refugees are waiting is exposed to the elements.
example.tran: 大多数难民等待救济的地方都不能挡风遮雨。

entry.tran: 自在;适得其所;如鱼得水
entry.def: If you say that someone is in their element, you mean that they are in a situation they enjoy.

example.ex: My stepmother was in her element, organizing everything...
example.tran: 我的继母得心应手地料理着一切。

example.ex: Maybe it's because they're so out of their element that they feel the need to talk.
example.tran: 可能是因为他们感到非常不自在，所以觉得有必要说说话。

sentences.sentence: "jealousy was a component of his character"
"two constituents of a musical composition are melody and harmony"
"humor: an effective ingredient of a speech"

means.word_mean: 2. any of the more than 100 known substances (of which 92 occur naturally) that cannot be separated into simpler substances and that singly or in combination constitute all matter
3. an artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system;

sentences.sentence: "a component or constituent element of a system"

means.word_mean: 4. one of four substances thought in ancient and medieval cosmology to constitute the physical universe;

sentences.sentence: "the alchemists believed that there were four elements"

means.word_mean: 5. the most favorable environment for a plant or animal;
6. the situation in which you are happiest and most effective;
7. a straight line that generates a cylinder or cone

auth_sentence.res_content_con: In fact that's the one element missing here.

auth_sentence.res_content: It was that human element that Swindon fans appreciated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was that human element that Swindon fans appreciated.

auth_sentence.content: They are now the dynamic element of Cuban society.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are now the dynamic element of Cuban society.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are now the dynamic element of Cuban society.

Sentence.sentence: If you tell an acquaintance you are a grandfather who recently lost his wife and who does volunteer work on weekends, several elements of your self-image are bought to light — the roles of grandparent, widower and conscientious citizen.
There is an element there about competition then, isn't there?

means.word_mean: 成分, 要素, 原件, 基本部份, 典型部份

sentences.en: Cells are the elements of the human body.
sentences.cn: 细胞是人体的基本单位。

means.word_mean: 一伙人;（大团体或社会中的）一组，一群，一伙

sentences.en: They are the undesirable elements among the employees.
sentences.cn: 他们是雇员中的不良分子。

means.word_mean: 基础, 纲要, 原理

sentences.en: The elements of physics are difficult to grasp.
sentences.cn: 物理原理是很难掌握的。

jushi.english: I admit that there is an element of truth in what you say.
jushi.chinese: 我承认在你说的里面有一点点是真的。

jushi.english: We learn the elements of arithmetic before the 7th grade.
jushi.chinese: 在七年级前我们学习算术的基础知识。

jushi.english: The elements of physics are difficult to grasp.
jushi.chinese: 物理原理是很难掌握的。
